title: Small freezes during game since NBN
body:
Hi team,

I've had the NBN installed around a month ago now and ever since I've had issues which i believe is packet loss during games, mostly when alot of action is on the screen where it will just freeze for 1-2 seconds then catch up.

I've tried port forwarding which i believe i have done correctly, changing my DNS, i have called internode for assistance but very hard for them to assist as my ping/internet doesn't lag whatsoever. 

When i port forwarded/changed DNS i thought the issue was fixed as i played around 2-3 days without any issues but after that issue came back >_>

I can play other games completely fine it's just league that i get this issue with since the swap, i can put my mobile net back on on and a league game is fine so it's not my pc.

I'm just hoping is there any other ways i can identify where the issue is in my network - i'm really hoping it's not due to congestion and the times i play league is just when it's the worst.

It's happened both during morning/nights.

Any assistance is appreciated :)

replies.body: wireless or ethernet if its wireless you might have to go your router and see what channel its connected to most technicians suggest you change it a less congested channel but i dont recomend that if multiple people use the wifi if its ethernet then the provider is at fault
